text.p: These are the leading stories in the Algerian press on Thursday as reported by the official Algerian news agency APS. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Morocco releases three Algerians after 20 years of secret detention.
- The government prepares for the next academic year as the number of students reaches 7,246,000.
- The government, unions and business representatives face hard negotiations next week.
- Joint committee grouping political parties and presidency representatives submitted report to President Liamine Zeroual over party activity law.
- Three years after the killing of former prime minister Kasdi Merbi, mystery still shrouds the murder.
